titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution to require that congressional resolutions setting forth levels of total budget outlays and Federal revenues must be agreed to by two-thirds vote of both Houses of the Congress if the level of outlays exceeds the level of revenues.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Requires a two-thirds vote of both Houses of the Congress to pass any concurrent resolution on the budget in which outlays exceed revenues.
